meanings.definition: To edit or revise (a text) for publication.
meanings.sent1: She subedits the article before it goes to print.
meanings.sent2: The editor subedits all the articles for the magazine.
meanings.sent3: The writer joked that she subedits so much, she dreams of correcting typos.
meanings.sent4: He subedits his writing with precision, like a surgeon with a scalpel.
meanings.sent5: Subediting is like polishing a gem, making it shine brightly.

meanings.definition: To make editorial changes to (a document).
meanings.sent1: He subedits the report to improve its clarity.
meanings.sent2: The teacher subedits the students' essays for grammar errors.
meanings.sent3: The cat accidentally subedits the document by walking on the keyboard.
meanings.sent4: She subedits the text with a keen eye for detail.
meanings.sent5: Subediting is like adding the final brushstrokes to a painting.

meanings.definition: To prepare (a document) for publication by checking and correcting the text.
meanings.sent1: The publishing team subedits the manuscript before sending it to the printer.
meanings.sent2: She subedits the book to ensure it is error-free.
meanings.sent3: The robot subedits the document at lightning speed.
meanings.sent4: He subedits the text meticulously, like a detective solving a case.
meanings.sent5: Subediting is like giving a document a makeover, making it look its best.
